intro: Romanschulzia orizabae, commonly known as the Orizaba romanceschulzia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in disturbed or open habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
